Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ulku-boztas
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in hotel Sultanahmet few weeks ago during our visit in Istanbul, the location of the hotel was perfect as we were in reach of everywhere we wished to visit, the rooms were clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, we would definately go back to this hotel, especaily to have a nice drink in Terrace cafe with the magical view of Sultanahmet Mosque, we highly recommend hotel Sultanahmet to everyone, thank you very much for the magical experience,

Reviews.Title: “Oriental great location”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkermarzipan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean location was very good we reach all the important places very easly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: canerandagio
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near the sites, shops, transport, etc. Marvellous view from the terrace and possibly from the room, depending on which room you get. It is not easy to find a better view, the blue mosque is there smiling to you, with the Marmara sea in the background. Clean room and spotless toilet. Excellent very helpful and friendly staff. Good Breakfast. Small room, with average quality fittings. We found this place to be excellent for our budget. If you want a top hotel you better find something else, but if you want to stay on a budget then this place is absolutely perfect... highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in great location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mia2009Leivadeia
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul a couple of weeks ago! It was an amazing experience as was our first time in this outstanding city! The hotel was small but with excellent service and near to a lot of turistic sightseeings, like Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque!!! We stayed there 3 nights. Many thanks to CIIGDEM (the person at the reception) who helped us with her useful informations!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, avoid spoiling your holidays”
Reviews.Author: Me-and-London
Reviews.Content: Writing to warn all potential Istanbul visitors and just hope I will help someone to avoid the mistake we did - do not book this hotel. Be aware that the rooms are extremely small (even for a budget place), dirty, old and smelly. The window in the room was â€œfacingâ€� some brick well with a spiral staircase in it. The toilet and shower is a small cabinet, there is no a separate shower cabin, so when taking the shower the water is all around. There was a hole in the ceiling right on top. There is a terrace with a nice view â€“ it is true, however for this part of Istanbul, this is quite a common thing â€“ majority of the hotels around here have a terrace. The breakfast was awful, comparing to other Istanbul hotels â€“ just unacceptable. I do realise that there are different levels of hotels and one should not expect 5 stars amenities for the price of 60-70 Euro, but honestly, you can find better for this price. Do not stay here â€“ you will regret and your holidays will be spoiled. There are lots of other good budget hotels with great service in Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and good location BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Shadya
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the location close to several historical sites, and the beautiful view from the breckfast balcony. The lobby of the hotel is pretty, and the staff are nice. We stayed overnight for about 190 Italian Lira, or 70 Euros. Be advised the rooms are not that nice. The room we had was barely sufficient, with a shower located in a tiny toilet. The room had airconditioning, but no way to turn it on. We had a room which was fairly quiet from the street traffic, but you could hear others in the surrounding rooms. Cleanliness is questionable. The point of staying in such a place, is to use the location. Close to restaurants & stores. Bring your own soap, the soap in the room is not sufficient. The breckfast was great, and we made friends at the hotel. The family we met felt their room was not sufficient either. Also, there is no elevator, and the breckfast balconly was 4 flights up from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Verry good location”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkermarzipan
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Hotel is clean. Breakfeast was great. Thede sere a lot of option to eat and they were delicious

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cdogruer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with the kind stuff! Very pleased to stay ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: karlve
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful, charming staff - great location and nice rooms. All front desk staff were incredibly helpful and accomodating. Night porter Ozgur had a wonderful dry sense of humor and attempted to teach us some turkish words. Super breakfast on rooftop restaurant with wonderful views of Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. Can't say enough nice things about the accomodations, and staff. Wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GULCENO
Reviews.Content: My frieng recomended this hotel. Because location and cleaning were very important for me and hotel was the best location in the old city and very clean hotel and all room staff was white color. A.C was quite, sheets changed everyday... My room was on the 3.floor (303) view with sea and Blue Mosque....breakfast was amazing on the terrace with very nice panorama...

Reviews.Title: “better then hostel”
Reviews.Author: DOFU
Reviews.Content: Well, it was a last minute thing, and we only wanted a place to sleep and shower, so it did the job. Because we did not stay very much in the Hotel, I cannot comment on the staff and other stuff, however we did hear a number of people complaining at the front desk about all sorts. We had never been to Istanbul before, so we decided to book for two nights ,look around and if we liked it then we would return , guess what we are going back there next month for one week, different hotel of course. We booked our return airport transfer from a website called www.thisisturkey.net/istanbul and hired a tour guide from the same website who happens to be a very friendly young man name Ercan, who made it very easy for us, he took us to places where we would not have found unless we had a very detailed military map with us. No one bothered us including stall owners or sales people as we had our guide with us. Ercan was incredibly informative, he was answering all our questions in a very easy way without boring us. We paid him for a full days tour guiding, Â£85 sterling which was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: SergiusT
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel twice - once out of desperation (arrived too late) and the second because a friend booked it without telling me which one it was. Otherwise I wouldn't have gone near it again. It is just too small, shabby and noisey. We asked for a twin bedded room and found the beds had been moved together so it looked like a double bed - there wasn't enough room to seperate them. There is no furniture in the room i.e. wardrobe or place to put clothes or put a suitcase so you spend all your time dodging backpacks or shoes. It has the athmosphere of a hostel really. The 'en suite' toilet and bathroom was so tiny that you could do yourself some serious damage if you moved too fast or without care and attention. I used the shower in the corridor as at least I could move in it. The trolleybus starts at 6 in the morning and is right outside the hotel. I read reviewers saying it is convenient for the sights but unless you're on two walking sticks it is really of no advantage. The breakfast is adequate but I have tasted much better for the same price in the same location. The only advantage is the view from the balcony which overlooks the Blue Mosque - which you can also hear loud and clear at 4 in the morning. There are too many hotels in the area, especially at the other end of the Hippodrome to pay â‚¬80 for these sort of rooms. They should cut the pretense and just call it a hostel and cut the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, shabby, triple room with only one window looking out at a wall and emergency exit ladder”
Reviews.Author: THB2011
Reviews.Content: We booked two triple rooms and a double room well in advance. At no point did the hotel explain that the triples were small, dark back rooms (L-shaped) with only one window (the third floor triple had two small windows both at one end) looking out on walls and an emergency ladder. I think it would have been fairer to point out this fact. We certainly wouldn't have booked this hotel if we had known and furthermore would have been able to book far nicer rooms for even less than we spent here . We tried, throughout our entire 3 day stay, to speak to the manager about our rooms with no success. We shan't return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: NoshD
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and a 10min walk to all the tourist attractions including the Grand Bazar, Hippodrome, Ble Mosque, Underground cistern and Hagia Sophia. Their rooftop restaurant has the best stuffed grape leaves and baklava we tasted on our entire trip. A slight disappointment- the rooftop view looks nothing like the photograph they have in the elevator, its blocked in large part by surrounding buildings. Ask for a room facing the front of the hotel-they have a small balcony and a nicer view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: booyah8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stay in Turkey and is great value for money. It was 140euro for private room with ensuite and an amazing breakfast each morning served on roof top terrace over looking blue mosque absolutely lovely. Rooms are quite small but the hotel is directly across from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and only a short walk to Topyaki palace, grand Bazaar and the rest of the 'old city' highlights. Tram stop right out front which will take you to 'new city and/or airport or alot of other places too and only costs about 2-4TL to anywhere. The owners were very accommodating and helpful. Highly recommend it to anyone wanting a great value hotel right in the heart of everything the old city.

Reviews.Title: “cosy and great position”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters194449
Reviews.Content: So, as others have mentioned, the rooms are small, but very clean, warm and cosy after a day's sightseeing in the cold January rain. There was a good choice for breakfast (even for us vegetarians) The staff are really friendly and helpful and we appreciated being picked up at the airport with no extra charge. Hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located in old Istanbul and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a standard room, facing away from the street and Blue Mosque, with none of the noise problems of other reviewers. The room was better than adequate. The price was mid-range, and provided good value for money. We had no problems with air conditioning. The hotel is low rise set in attractive gardens and located directly over the buried ruins of the Roman Emperors palace and just behind the Blue Mosque. It is difficult to find a better location for appreciating the main monuments of old Istanbul. It is also very close to the excellent restaurants in Cankurtaran. As with many hotels in Turkey, there was no plug for the sink. Take one with you if you need it for shaving or laundry. Breakfast buffet is served in the restaurant, and can be taken on the terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea. The criticisms of other reviewers do not seem to be justified. Other hotel services were satisfactory or better â€“ particularly the free transfer to the airport in a comfortable van

Reviews.Title: “Best not to book at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dratch
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel (nice people, very nice breakfast terrace) BE SURE to ask if the room has a bathroom (an unusual precaution these days) but also ask if the room has a window (even more unusual). Be warned. And if you do have a window, make sure the A/C is working (and that you can reach the switch) because the mosque loudspeakers are about 10 feet from the window facing the Blue Mosque. Felt very sorry for the captive terrapins in the foyer

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingdirector
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay there. Rooms were a little small, but they bumped us up to a slightly larger space which was comfortable for us (we mostly slept in the room and were out all day exploring). We recommended the hotel to two other parties and they also had a positive experience. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Everything is flexible if you ask nicely. Call to prayer woke us up a couple of times, but on other days, the speaker wasn't on so it didn't bother us. I think for the view from the rooftop, location, and value for money, this is a great choice. If you really need to be pampered, spend money in one of the more commercial hotel, but, if you only need a comfortable space and easy location, then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very compact, friendly service, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KisumuMuhindi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights and had an enjoyable stay in Istanbul. On arrival we were disappointed with the room being so small. However we were moved the next day to a bigger room with good views over the Blue Mosque. The room was not huge but it was fine. Ensuite also very compact but ok. Breakfast on the roof terrace was great and the staff service was always firendly and helpful. Location and proximity to Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace was fantastic, with plenty of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it”
Reviews.Author: rharoldr
Reviews.Content: 100 euros a night ! You're joking. This hotel is a shocker. I'm sure it has a variety of rooms but the no view tiny room i had was terrible. The ensuite was 5 foot x 2 foot and doubled as a shower, poorly maintained. If you've got a suitcase you may have to lug it up 3 floors of spiral staircase. The hotel is noisy, from other guests not external noise. The view from the terrace is fantastic and the location is excellent, but there are equal views and better value all round from other hotels in areas just as close to all the sights. (There is 24 hour reception service because the owner has his bed in the lobby)

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust what the written information that the hotel provides you with before arrival.”
Reviews.Author: MsLittleNorway
Reviews.Content: I booked 7 nights at the Sultanahmet hotel. Reading the reviews I realized the hotel had some rooms without a window. I made sure to express that it was extremely important for us to have a room with a window and was assured in an e-mail we would get one of their nicest rooms and definitely one with a window. On arrival we received a room without a window. We changed rooms later, but this was such a bad start and gave us a 1st night with no sleep whatsoever. I was deeply disappointed to experience that what had been promised was worth nothing later. The next room we got was nice and we were happy with the rest of our stay, however, I cannot recommend this hotel when you cannot trust that you get a room with a window. A tiny room with no window is not a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “poor service non friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MohamadFarid
Reviews.Content: twice we spent our vacation in Istanbul for year 2008 and 2009 both in the month of March, Both times spent wonderfully, stayed in Ambassador hotel.On 2009 December thought of celebrating new year in Istanbul and because of the location of this hotel and from what it look we booked a room for our year end holiday.To our surprise the room given to us was completely small without any window,the room was stuffy ,unfriendly room service lady and not much for your breakfast not even omelet.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, top service, wonderful roof terrace with a splendid view to Blue Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: 123Oslo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice but small rooms, top service by friendly and attentive staff, excellent location near the main attractions of Istanbul and a wonderful roof terrace with a splendid view to the Blue Mosque and Bosporus. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: RA_UK
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location (opposite blue mosque, on Divanlou), good views (mosques rather than the sea) cheap, bed comfortable, breakfast on terrace with great view, internet access by the lobby Cons: small room, minimal storage, bathroom-showeroom all in one small area (but v clean), some rooms have a fan rather than air con, noise from the street (but double glazing windows work v well)

Reviews.Title: “If you like room without any window, go for it”
Reviews.Author: Babyrock
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is one of my favourites, so I expected a lovely stay in a lovely family owned hotel. However, when we finally got to the hotel, after a pretty long flight, I was completely disappointed by what I saw when I entered the lobby of the hotel. Please see the photos attached to this review, which are indicative without any other comments needed. The room I stayed in had NO window, although the prospect promised 'a marvellous view on Blue Mosque'. It was nothing to breathe in the room. The bathroom is worth separate mentioning. It is very small room with no separate shower place, so if you take shower all your toilet paper, sink and toilet itself got wet. The mirror was in an awful condition as well. Please see the video, as I can not describe it fully. The breakfast is served on a nice terrace, but taking into consideration that winter happens sometine in Istanbul, it is Absolutely not usable in December - February. We escaped this hotel the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the euros.”
Reviews.Author: larry_nyc
Reviews.Content: The first thing to note is that you're in the middle of everything --and that's both good and bad. By luck and intent, we stayed at the Sultanahmet during the first day of Ramadan, and the city was alive. So alive, that by 3am, we wanted people to actually go to sleep. Rooms facing the street have the best views but are among the loudest. Remember the main tram is outside your window. There are rooms that face away from the street, but these either face another building or nothing at all. There are lovely and amazing views of the Blue Mosque from some of the rooms, towards the Bosphorous, but most of them will face the smaller mosque (still pretty). They're also generally small and most rooms facing the street will not have air conditioning. You'll have to weigh your poison: loud street noise with the window open, or a bit warmer yet quieter with the window closed. The manager said they were looking into installing them with no timetable. The staff is friendly, gracious, and speak a little English. The rooftop restaurant for breakfast offers fantastic views (though because of the angle, not as good as you might expect). Free and reasonably fast Internet is available downstairs. In all, if your primary reason for staying in the Sultanahmet area is access to everything, but are still on a budget, then this is probably the best hotel you'll be able to manage for under $60 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrekkerGirl
Reviews.Content: This place was so beautiful! I felt like I was staying in a royal palace, but with a more personal feel. The rooms were a good size, and I loved that the windows have a window seat where you can sit/lie, and open the window and stick your head out and smell the sea, and view the Sultan Ahmet Mosque literally right across the street. The bathroom is really cool, with a traditional Turkish bath that also can work as a shower. The lobby of the hotel is just right, not too big - small enough to sit around with friends and meet other people staying there all around a little table. The staff was very polite, and the bellhop/room service guy was incredibly helpful, above and beyond what anyone could expect. Hmm, all I can say is if I'm fortunate enough to go back to Istanbul I want to stay here! If only they would let me move in ....

HotelInfo.Name: Sultanahmet Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Divanyolu Cad No 20 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 340110, Turkey
